availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin C. Trapnall (Resident of Mercer County, Kentucky,)

body.p: Harrodsburg, Mercer County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Attorney in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Harrodsburg in 1850. Attorney in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Harrodsburg in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 346B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg District 2, p. 913
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 694.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 47A.
Find A Grave, "Ben. C. Trapnall (1818-1874)," Memorial #137664929, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/137664929 (accessed May 20, 2020).
